outputs.name: model
outputs.description:
A Honeybee Model object possessing all of the input geometry
objects.

inputs.name: rooms_
inputs.description:
A list of honeybee Rooms to be added to the Model. Note that at
least one Room is necessary to make a simulate-able energy model.

inputs.name: faces_
inputs.description:
A list of honeybee Faces to be added to the Model. Note that
faces without a parent Room are not allowed for energy models.

inputs.name: shades_
inputs.description: A list of honeybee Shades to be added to the Model.

inputs.name: apertures_
inputs.description:
A list of honeybee Apertures to be added to the Model. Note
that apertures without a parent Face are not allowed for energy models.

inputs.name: doors_
inputs.description:
A list of honeybee Doors to be added to the Model. Note
that doors without a parent Face are not allowed for energy models.

inputs.name: _name_
inputs.description:
Text to be used for the name and identifier of the Model. If no
name is provided, it will be "unnamed".

code:
try:  # import the core honeybee dependencies
    from honeybee.model import Model
    from honeybee.typing import clean_string
except ImportError as e:
    raise ImportError('\nFailed to import honeybee:\n\t{}'.format(e))

try:  # import the ladybug_{{cad}} dependencies
    from ladybug_{{cad}}.{{plugin}} import all_required_inputs
    from ladybug_{{cad}}.config import units_system, tolerance, angle_tolerance
except ImportError as e:
    raise ImportError('\nFailed to import ladybug_{{cad}}:\n\t{}'.format(e))


def check_all_geo_none():
    """Check whether all of the geometry inputs to this component are None."""
    return all(obj_list == [] or obj_list == [None] for obj_list in
               (rooms_, faces_, shades_, apertures_, doors_))


if all_required_inputs(ghenv.Component) and not check_all_geo_none():
    # set a default name and get the {{Cad}} Model units
    name = clean_string(_name_) if _name_ is not None else 'unnamed'
    units = units_system()

    # create the model
    model = Model(name, rooms_, faces_, shades_, apertures_, doors_,
                  units=units, tolerance=tolerance, angle_tolerance=angle_tolerance)
    if _name_ is not None:
        model.display_name = _name_
name: HB Model
description:
Create a Honeybee Model, which can be sent for simulation.
-
